show.title: Ranching Reboot
show.summary: Rebooting your thinking about Farming, Ranching and Food production. Conversations in land stewardship with some of today's most innovative ranchers and producers. Support this podcast: https://anchor.fm/ranching-reboot/support

title: #89 Caitlin Hebbert
subtitle: #89 Caitlin Hebbert
summary:
I give up on snappy titles, message me if you would like them to come back.
Caitlin Hebbert serves as a livestock consultant in the producer relations program. Her areas of interest include preconditioning management, grazing cattle nutrition and replacement heifer development. During her time in college and graduate school, she gained experience at a veterinary diagnostic lab and at a research feedlot. She also conducted research in the fields of wheat stocker nutrition and mineral supplementation effects on heifer reproductive development and immunocompetence.

EDUCATION

  • Master of Science in Ruminant Nutrition, New Mexico State University, 2018
  • Bachelor of Science in Animal Science, West Texas A&M University, 2015
CERTIFICATIONS
  • Oklahoma Beef Quality Assurance
PROFESSIONAL MEMBERSHIPS
  • American Registry of Professional Animal Scientists
  • American Society of Animal Science
  • National Cattlemen’s Beef Association
  • Oklahoma Cattlemen’s Association
  • Texas and Southwestern Cattle Raisers Association
  • Working Ranch Cowboys Association
